      • setEndAngle

        public void setEndAngle(java.lang.Number endAngle)
        The end angle of the polar X axis or gauge value axis, given in degrees where 0 is north. Defaults to startAngle + 360.

        Try it:

         •  VU-meter with custom start and end angle

      • getEndAngle

        public java.lang.Number getEndAngle()

      • setStartAngle

        public void setStartAngle(java.lang.Number startAngle)
        The start angle of the polar X axis or gauge axis, given in degrees where 0 is north. Defaults to 0.

        Try it:

         •  VU-meter with custom start and end angle

      • getStartAngle

        public java.lang.Number getStartAngle()

      • setCenter

        public void setCenter(java.util.ArrayList center)
        The center of a polar chart or angular gauge, given as an array of [x, y] positions. Positions can be given as integers that transform to pixels, or as percentages of the plot area size.

        Try it:

         •  Two gauges with different center

        default:

         ["50%", "50%"]

      • getCenter

        public java.util.ArrayList getCenter()

      • setBackground

        public void setBackground(java.util.ArrayList background)
        An array of background items for the pane.

        Try it:

         •  Speedometer gauge with multiple backgrounds

      • getBackground

        public java.util.ArrayList getBackground()

      • setSize

        public void setSize(java.lang.Object size)
        The size of the pane, either as a number defining pixels, or a percentage defining a percentage of the plot are.

        Try it:

         •  Smaller size

        default:

         85%
